130h de jeu, peut importe l'heure et le jour, peut importe les s√©ries de victoires ou de d√©faites, le matchmaking me met avec des joueurs avec plus de 1500 heures de jeu que ce soit en survivants ou tueur.
Evidemment, c'est toujours les m√™me build de chaque c√¥t√© et si un joueur d√©cide de faire un build "fun", soit il part pour troll la game soit il meurt en premier ou perd la game rapidement en tueur.
Le fun n'existe pas sur le jeu a moins de jouer avec un groupe en personnaliser.
Si vous voulez jouer √† ce jeu pour vous divertir ou jouer en solo, passer votre chemin.

[ Is It Good? ]

Yes. 
+ This game is FUN.  Like really fun.  I have more than a few non-gamer friends that love this game.
+ For such a simple concept, it has extreme depth.  Options for loadouts are wildy deep.  It's actually quite amazing seeing the interplay between them all and it typically works well.
- Buggy.  I'm on a bunch of Discord servers for games and the DBD Discord is constantly pinging server crashes, bugs, etc.  The devs do seem to keep on it, but it's noticeably problematic.
- Without friends the game is much less entertaining.  Can still solo queue but it's really meant to be communal.

[Is It Worth the Price?]

On sale.
There is so much DLC that although it's totally worth $20, you'll fork over more later if you get into it.  Save up front so you can grab some DLC.

The gameplay can be really fun, but you must be aware of how tryhard many of the community members are, including myself, and the imbalance of perks and abilities available for killers and survivors.

Game is fun when you have good team and killer, not so fun when you don't. There are a few elements the game that the makers need to sort out and evening the playing field for both killer and survivor. Its a hard grind getting good, but in short terms... "Git gud" and have fun. The community is hit or miss - wish the game would focus more on team work and communication for the survivors.

Matchmaking is completely screwed. As an ash 4 killer, I have had WAY too many lobbies with red 1 survivors, half of the time it's more than one, mind you. Fix your mm, dbd. This is ridiculous. I don't get on so I can get bullied by survivors that are 30x better than me. The only way you should play, at this point, is if you're playing customs. It's not worth it, otherwise.

Over all I think this game is fun and can be very challenging. However there are multiple issues with the game. Things like deadhard and hitting a survivor when they are unhooking someone can be buggy. I think the game is worth its price and I have gotten my worth out of it. Just try to remember its a game and you are playing against other human beings. It is easy to get tilted playing this just try and have fun dont take the bm personal.

Came from console and decided to get this game on sale to play with friends. Player base was consistently toxic (body blocking, leaving matches, and assisting killers by ratting out positions) which effectively ruined the game. After two initial wins, my friend and I got paired with high rated killers with max perks and add-ons which ended our matches in minutes when mori and Michael Myers one shot at level three add-on. Matchmaking continues to be a regular issue where survivors have long queue times to get dogged by experienced killers. This game has potential that is stifled by a regular release of content that does nothing to assuage the glaring issues that barrel stuff new players. Quite honestly a waste of money in its current state unless you like dealing with these kinds of problems on a regular basis.

how did you manage to make this game even worse

I love horror movie and this game really captures that feeling of being hunter in a horror movie. The killers are all really cool and each one feels unique. One of the things I love the most is how the killers capture what makes their movie counterparts so great. Like how Michael Myers wants to stalk his victims and you can hear his breathing. Such a great game and years later it's still getting support for new heroes and killers. I really want them to release Chucky.

Wenn man ein oder zwei Freunde zum spielen hat, macht es noch mehr Spa√ü als Solo. Um alle Perks zu bekommen muss man schon viel grinden bzw. spielen, aber das Spiel macht auch nach l√§ngerer Zeit noch echt bock! Das Base Game bietet erstmal gut Content, und die DLCs sind bei Bedarf echt g√ºnstig zu haben (Stichwort: Key). Man kauft diese sowieso wegen dem Killer oder bestimmten Perks. Wenn man nicht reincashen will, kann man auch sogenannte "Scherben" verdienen mit denen man auch einzelne Perks, Survivor, Killer oder Cosmetics einzeln kaufen kann (Dies dauert zwar etwas, ist aber durchaus im machbaren).  Community leider sehr sehr toxic, deswegen mit Freunden deutlich angenehmer. Leicht zu lernen, aber bietet nach einiger Zeit auch hohes Potential, um sein Gameplay zu perfektionieren.
Juego increible para pasar el rato con amigos.

Tiene una comunidad sumamente  toxica. Al jugar de asesino no se puede tener una partida tranquila y lenta, se tiene que comenzar desde que se toma el control del personaje a correr por todo el mapa sin descanso por 20 min para con algo de suerte poder matar a 1 survivor. El meta actual favorece de sobremanera a los survivors dejando a la gran mayor√≠a de asesinos sin lugar en el meta; literalmente si no se juega 1 de los 4 asesinos metagame con perks muy especificas la √∫nica opci√≥n que queda es "Campear" en cierto grado o tunelear a 1 survivor para obtener una ventaja (cosas que son muy mal vistas y se llevaran unos cuantos insultos al terminar la partida y hasta comentarios en su perfil de steam, insult√°ndolos y denigr√°ndolos)
